title: Te-I mix - conclude purity of Te from mass spec

content.prompt: The elements I and Te have similar average atomic masses. A sample that was believed to be a mixture of I and Te was run through a mass spectrometer, resulting in the data above. All of the following statements are true. Which one would be the best basis for concluding that the sample was pure Te?

choices.label: Te forms ions with a −2 charge, whereas I forms ions with a −1 charge.
Te is more abundant than I in the universe.
I consists of only one naturally occurring isotope with 74 neutrons, whereas Te has more than one isotope.
I has a higher first ionization energy than Te does.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
